channel.title: Colour picker problem, Jsfiddle <3 [Fixed]
channel.description:
Thanks to HcoJustin for fixing it <3
[quote="HcoJustin"]Ids are supposed to be unique. Therefore it is invalid html to have #test appear twice in the DOM. Not to mention getElementById will return one single Element.
Switch it out to use classes and then iterate over the list of Elements applying your style to each one. http://jsfiddle.net/S9wHT/1/[/quote]

item.title: Colour picker problem, Jsfiddle <3 [Fixed]
item.dc:creator: @Frantix Frantix
item.description:
@Frantix wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:2, topic:543829”]Ids are supposed to be unique. Therefore it is invalid html to have #test appear twice in the DOM. Not to mention getElementById will return one single Element.

Switch it out to use classes and then iterate over the list of Elements applying your style to each one. http://jsfiddle.net/S9wHT/1/[/quote]

Thanks man, I was attempting to use a for loop but im still a nooob in javascript. But thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Colour picker problem, Jsfiddle <3 [Fixed]
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Ids are supposed to be unique. Therefore it is invalid html to have #test appear twice in the DOM. Not to mention getElementById will return one single Element.

Switch it out to use classes and then iterate over the list of Elements applying your style to each one. http://jsfiddle.net/S9wHT/1/

Read full topic
